link.synopsis: Comic book collector Archie (DJ Qualls) is an innocent bystander caught in the rivalry between two comic book shops. One owner (Donal Logue) runs his store because he loves comics. The other shop, owned by a husband and wife (Michael Rapaport and Natasha Lyonne), is run strictly for profit. The tense situation blows up when a sneak collector discovers a large amount of perfectly preserved classic comics and both shops fight to own them.
link.title: synopsis
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
Nightmares in Red, White and Blue
Wishmaster 3: Beyond the Gates of Hell

link.synopsis: Boldly original comedian Louis C.K. brings the audience to hysterics in this live HBO stand-up performance. In a blistering routine, the award-winning comic exposes life's most absurd realities with his signature blend of raw wit and twisted wisdom. Named one of the "Ten Comics to Watch" by &NFi;Variety&NFi_;, C.K. won an Emmy for his comedy writing and has appeared regularly on Comedy Central, HBO and many late-night talk shows.
link.title: synopsis
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Billy Connolly: Live in New York
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
Comedy Express Presents: Al Ducharme: Spineless and Lovin' It
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Comedy Jump Off: The Latino Connection
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy

link.synopsis: When fate lands three hapless men -- an unemployed disc jockey (Tom Waits), a small-time pimp (John Lurie) and a strong-willed Italian tourist (Roberto Benigni) -- in a New Orleans prison, their mutual confinement launches a grand adventure toward escape and freedom. Director Jim Jarmusch delivers a twisted comedy filled with fine performances and sharp black-and-white frames from cinematographer Robby Müller.
link.title: synopsis
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: When cryogenics researcher Virgil Stamp (Robert Harriell) falls for Emma (Ella Rae Peck), a juvenile schoolgirl half his age, he schemes to use his cutting-edge technology to freeze himself and then thaw himself out 15 years later, when he and the girl will be the same age. But Virgil emerges from suspended animation early -- and faces some seriously unintended consequences. Charles Hood directs this comedy; Jamie Milward co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Timerider: The Adventure of Lyle Swann
The Mysteries of Angels and Demons

link.synopsis: In this odd-couple comedy, Ray Liotta plays Walter Pearce, a cheating suburban dad who is forced to room with Skylar Eckerman (Shaun Sipos), the injured high school football star next door. Walter enlists Skylar's help in winning back his wife (Glenne Headly) and then helps Skylar patch up some problems in his own life. The sweet comedy was written and directed by "Kids in the Hall" cast member Bruce McCulloch.
link.title: synopsis
The Five People You Meet in Heaven
Bring It On: All or Nothing

link.synopsis: Although she adores her bevy of gay male companions and "fruit fly" lifestyle, still-single Violet (Mindy Cohn) is on the verge of turning 40 and longing for romance with a straight man in this quirky indie comedy from director Casper Andreas. Prompted by a vacuous co-worker (Kim Allen), Violet forsakes her homosexual pals to find Mr. Right -- but her decision may entail more changes than she's prepared to handle.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: This passionate story of a blood feud centers on Caco (Antonio Canales), a proud man who must fight for his family's honor and safety. After his daughter dies, Caco transfers his protective love to Diego (Orestes Villasan Rodriguez), his young, mentally challenged nephew, who has been threatened by a rival family. As tensions mount, so does the intensity of Spain's powerful flamenco music.
link.title: synopsis
Carlos Saura's Flamenco Trilogy: Blood Wedding
Blue Eyes of the Broken Doll

link.synopsis: Broadcast live on October 2, 2002, from Radio City Music Hall, this spectacular tribute to the music of John Lennon was a concert of prayer and healing for New York City to benefit the relief efforts in the wake of the Sept. 11 attacks. Academy Award winner Kevin Spacey hosts the all-star concert, which includes performances from Stone Temple Pilots, Nelly Furtado, Alanis Morissette, Cyndi Lauper, Marc Anthony and more.
link.title: synopsis
Dave Matthews: Weekend on the Rocks
Classic Albums: John Lennon: Plastic Ono Band
Dave Matthews Band: Live at Folsom Field Boulder, Colorado
The Beatles: The First U.S. Visit
Warren Haynes: The Benefit Concert: Vol. 8
Eric Clapton & Friends in Concert: The Crossroads Benefit
Saturday Night Live: 25 Years of Music
Joan Baez: How Sweet the Sound
Dave Matthews Band: The Central Park Concert
Dave Matthews & Tim Reynolds: Live at Radio City Music Hall
Janet Jackson: Design of a Decade
The Lighthouse Family: The Very Best of the Lighthouse Family
ABBA: The Winner Takes It All
Three Dog Night: Live with the Tennessee Symphony Orchestra

title.regular: Come Together: A Night for John Lennon's Words and Music

link.synopsis: This oceanic voyage celebrates the launch of the Cunard line's &NFi;Queen Mary 2&NFi_; -- the largest ocean liner in the world at the time the program was filmed -- 70 years after the company launched its fabled &NFi;Queen Mary&NFi_;. Sailing from Fort Lauderdale, Fla., to Rio de Janeiro for the annual Carnival, this cruise duplicates the historic path of the flagship &NFi;S.S. Normandie&NFi_;, which transported a boatload of rich and famous revelers to the same spot in 1939.
link.title: synopsis
SS United States: Lady in Waiting
Reader's Digest Scenic Cruises of the World
Europe to the Max: Alpine Secrets
Rick Steves: Austria and the Alps 2000-2009
Adventures in America's Western Parks: Glacier / Zion & Bryce
1000 Places to See Before You Die: Collection 1
Cowboy Country: The Complete Story of the Wild West
Jean-Michel Cousteau: Ocean Adventures: America's Underwater Treasures
Europe to the Max: Romantic Germany and Beyond
Adventures in America's Western Parks: The Great Southwest
Adventures in America's Western Parks: Great Train Rides / Lodges and Inns
All Aboard! American Train Journeys: Vol. 2
All Aboard! American Train Journeys: Vol. 1
1000 Places to See Before You Die: Collection 2
Passport to Europe: England, Ireland & Scotland
America's Great Road Trips & Scenic Drives
Amazon Trek: In Search of Vanishing Secrets

title.regular: Come Aboard: Queen Mary 2 to Rio
title.short: Come Aboard: Queen Mary 2 to Rio

link.synopsis: With chaotic social fires swirling around them, seven college students (Vanessa Gomez, Cooney Horvath, Jen Kim, Spencer Ryan, David Stamps, Mark Strano and Marisa Sullivan) come together to seek shelter from the 1992 Los Angeles riots at a mansion in the Hollywood Hills, where inhibitions fall by the wayside, thanks in part to an open bar. Director Charles B. Unger also penned the script for this coming-of-age teen romp based on actual events.
link.title: synopsis
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

link.synopsis: After discovering he's not really black like the rest of his family, likable dimwit Navin Johnson (Steve Martin) runs off on a hilarious misadventure in this comedy classic that takes him from rags to riches and back to rags again. The slaphappy jerk strikes it rich, but life in the fast lane isn't all it's cracked up to be and, in the end, all that really matters to Johnson is his true love (Bernadette Peters).
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin

link.synopsis: Exceptionally ambitious high schooler Matthew (Emile Hirsch) has aspirations for a career in politics when he falls in love with his gorgeous 19-year-old neighbor, Danielle (Elisha Cuthbert). But Matthew's bright future is jeopardized when he finds Danielle was once a porn star. As Danielle's past catches up with her, Matthew's love for her forces him to re-evaluate his goals in this romantic comedy co-starring Timothy Olyphant and Paul Dano.
link.title: synopsis
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Bill Cosby, television's favorite avuncular funnyman and one of the longtime masters of stand-up comedy, treats his fans to this funny, satirical and heartwarming live concert from Canada. Riffing on such varied subjects as the trial by fire of marriage, parenthood and the side-splitting antics of toddlers, and even a hilarious encounter at a dentist's office, Cosby will tickle your funny bone until you hurt from laughing!
link.title: synopsis
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Sinbad: Son of a Preacher Man
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
I Don't Know How She Does It
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: Singing, dancing and showgirls enliven this musical comedy set in the famed New York nightclub. In his first film appearance without his brothers, Groucho Marx plays sleazy theatrical agent (and terrible performer) Lionel Devereaux. His only client is his fiance, fruit-hatted songstress Carmen (Carmen Miranda). Comic shenanigans ensue when Devereaux books her for two appearances at the club on the same night -- as two different people.
link.title: synopsis
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Utopian clergyman Ivan (Mads Mikkelsen) finds his starry-eyed outlook challenged by neo-Nazi Adam Pedersen (Ulrich Thomsen) in this black comedy from director Anders Thomas Jensen. Just out of prison and ordered to perform community service at Ivan's rural church, the sullen Adam is tasked with tending the chapel's beloved apple tree. But he's determined to undercut Ivan's rosy worldview … which proves harder than Adam ever imagined.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress

link.synopsis: After being bullied into marrying an overbearing woman (played by Eddie Murphy in drag), mild-mannered Norbit (also portrayed by Murphy) meets the girl of his dreams (Thandie Newton) in this screwball romantic comedy. But can Norbit find a way to ditch his repulsive spouse and be with his true love? Directed by Brian Robbins (The Shaggy Dog), the film also stars Cuba Gooding Jr., Eddie Griffin and Katt Williams.
link.title: synopsis
The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach

link.synopsis: Banished from their primitive village after the tribe elders deem them too lazy, Zed (Jack Black) and Oh (Michael Cera) leave everything they've ever known behind and embark upon an adventure-filled journey through the ancient world. Co-starring Hank Azaria, Oliver Platt, Olivia Wilde and David Cross, this epic-sized laffer is a collaborative effort from comedy giants Harold Ramis (Groundhog Day) and Judd Apatow (Knocked Up).
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
Assassination of a High School President
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Ted (Taylor Nichols), a conservative, idealistic Chicago yuppie working in sales at his company's Barcelona office, is visited by his shallow, belligerent cousin Fred, a U.S. Navy officer. While bar-hopping, chasing women and philosophizing about love, they're inadvertently caught up in the volatile political climate of post-Franco Spain, which irrevocably alters their lives. Mira Sorvino co-stars in this romantic comedy with a serious slant.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: Rowan Atkinson brings his TV-based nincompoop Mr. Bean to the big screen. He arrives in Los Angeles to guard a famous painting, but as Mr. Bean is unfit for any physical task, everything goes hilariously wrong. A master of physical comedy, Atkinson pits the Brit Bean against his suspicious American hosts in a culture clash that makes for sidesplitting comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: Inventor Flint Lockwood creates a machine that makes clouds rain food, enabling the down-and-out citizens of Chewandswallow to feed themselves. But when the falling food reaches gargantuan proportions, Flint must scramble to avert disaster. Can he regain control of the machine and put an end to the wild weather before the town is destroyed? Bill Hader and Anna Faris lend their vocal talents to this Golden Globe-nominated animated adventure.
link.title: synopsis
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The ALVINNN!!! Edition
Labou and the Quest for the Lost Treasure
Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild
Tinker Bell and the Lost Treasure
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit

title.regular: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
title.short: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

link.synopsis: The Beatles's first movie -- a groundbreaking comedy often considered director Richard Lester's best film -- chronicles a "typical" day in their lives, filled with frenzied fans, crazy relatives and a soundtrack of familiar songs. The film defined the Beatles' impish appeal, and John, Paul, George and Ringo are surprisingly assured on-screen. Songs include "Can't Buy Me Love," "And I Love Her" and "I Should Have Known Better."
link.title: synopsis
Give My Regards to Broad Street
The Beatles: The First U.S. Visit
Composing the Beatles Songbook: Lennon and McCartney: 1966-1970
Paul McCartney: Get Back World Tour
The Beatles: From Liverpool to San Francisco
Beatles: From the Beginning to the End
Beatles: Composing the Beatles Songbook: Lennon and McCartney
The Beatles: Looking Back at the Beatles
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different

title.regular: A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
title.short: A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: Three vignettes highlight the surreal in this 1980 classic comedy written and directed by Jamie Uys. Among the three, the one about a Coke bottle falling out of the heavens and becoming a one-of-a-kind object coveted by everyone in a small African village is a cult favorite. The bottle creates such dissension that its finder, N!xau, decides the gods must've been crazy to give such a gift, so he sets out to drop it off the edge of the world.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World

link.synopsis: When absentminded Dr. Abner Perry (Peter Cushing) and his young American protégé, macho David Innes (Doug McClure), develop the Iron Mole, a contraption that cuts straight through solid rock, they have no idea what they're letting themselves in for in this campy sci-fi fantasy. The two bore their way from Victorian England to the center of the Earth, where they encounter a lost world of prehistoric beasts and their human slaves.
link.title: synopsis
Journey to the Center of the Earth
The Monster That Challenged the World

link.synopsis: First-time director Amy Hobby presents a breezy romantic comedy set in the small Irish town of Sligo (aka Coney Island), where Billy Hayes (screenwriter Karl Geary), a former small-time crook, has returned after a stint in New York City. But Billy's plans to take his former flame, Bridget (Laura Fraser), back with him to the States to run a gas station don't sit too well with the locals -- especially since Bridget is engaged to be married.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio

link.synopsis: When a professor (Jeff Goldblum) develops a vaccine that eliminates human allergies to dogs, he unwittingly upsets the fragile balance of power between cats and dogs and touches off an epic battle for pet supremacy. The fur flies in director Lawrence Guterman's family-friendly comedy as the feline faction, led by Mr. Tinkles (voiced by Sean Hayes), squares off against wide-eyed puppy Lou (Tobey Maguire) and his canine cohorts.
link.title: synopsis
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Adventures of Bailey: The Lost Puppy
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Vampire

link.synopsis: The fashion world is turned upside down when beautiful and utterly empty-headed male model Derek Zoolander (Ben Stiller, who also wrote and directed this comedy) discovers that fashion mogul Jacobim Mogatu (Will Ferrell) is behind a plot to assassinate the prime minister of Malaysia. But that's secondary to Derek's rivalry with rising star Hansel (Owen Wilson), his budding romance with Mathilda and the perfection of his new look, Blue Steel.
link.title: synopsis
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby

link.synopsis: After shy Midwesterner Charlie Bellow (Jesse Bradford) saves the wild Jordan Roark (Elisha Cuthbert) from falling to her death, he gets an instant vacation from his risk-averse, surprise-free lifestyle when the carefree beauty woos him. Jordan puts Charlie through the emotional ringer, until a dark secret from her past threatens to crush their courtship, in this charming romantic comedy -- a remake of the South Korean hit of the same name.
link.title: synopsis
Jack and Jill vs. the World
Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
The Other End of the Line

link.synopsis: French filmmaker Dominique Delouche showcases Monique Loudières, the famous principal dancer of the Paris Opera Ballet, in this documentary profile featuring her inspired interpretations of selections from "Giselle," "Don Quixote" and "In the Night." The fascinating film also includes a look at Loudières's coaching sessions with dancers such as Jerome Robbins, Violette Verdy, Yvette Chauviré and others.
link.title: synopsis
Les Milles: The Train of Liberty
How Much Do You Love Me?
Etoiles: Dancers of the Paris Opera Ballet
François Ozon: A Curtain Raiser & Other Shorts

link.synopsis: A celestial boo-boo sends soul-in-limbo Louie Jeffries into the body of Alex Finch (Robert Downey Jr.) in this heavenly romantic comedy. Louie lies dormant until Alex starts dating Miranda (Mary Stuart Masterson) -- the daughter of Louie's widow, Corinne (Cybill Shepherd). When Louie's memories are unleashed, Emile Ardolino's film gets as complex as a Shakespearian comedy, forcing all the players to sort out the remarkable events.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

link.synopsis: Collection agency employee Lorenzo Adams has substantial debt of his own with Uncle Frankie, an unforgiving loan shark. With his payment deadline fast approaching, Lorenzo fashions a wild scheme to get himself off the hook in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Wai in the Scripture with No Words
Across the Line: The Exodus of Charlie Wright
In the Blink of an Eye

link.synopsis: Eddie Murphy's classic 1983 stand-up comedy routine, filmed live in Washington, D.C., is still oft quoted ("You dropped your ice cream, you dropped your ice cream") and remembered for his raunchy, racy material and no-holds-barred delivery. Included never-before-seen footage and an interview with the funnyman himself. This act is definitely &NFi;not&NFi_; one to watch with your parents.
link.title: synopsis
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
George Carlin: What Am I Doing in New Jersey?
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
George Carlin: Playing with Your Head
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
The Decline of the American Empire
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
George Carlin: On Location With George Carlin

link.synopsis: As an elaborate practical joke, eccentric millionaire Cecil Fox (Rex Harrison) pretends to be gravely ill and beckons his three former mistresses to his deathbed, but his delightfully devious scheme goes horribly awry when one of the lovely ladies is murdered. This twisty crime comedy co-stars Susan Hayward as a Texas hypochondriac, Edie Adams as a fading starlet and Capucine as a distinguished princess.
link.title: synopsis
Smash-Up: The Story of a Woman
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
The Man in the White Suit
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
The Last Time I Saw Archie

link.synopsis: Based on a J.M. Barrie play, this genial comedy follows physician Robert Grey (John Lund) and his wife, Alice (Joan Fontaine), as they return to New York City after a long absence and are reunited with their children, Amy (Mona Freeman) and Cosmo (David Stollery). But the reunion goes hilariously awry when Amy becomes convinced that her mother is having an affair with another doctor (Peter Hansen) and schemes to protect Alice's virtue.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit

link.synopsis: Explore the life of the Buena Vista Social Club's Compay Segundo, a legendary musician who influenced Cuba's musical landscape for over 70 years. This documentary traces his early days, his two-decade retirement and his triumphant return in the '90s. Appearing solo and with his Buena Vista bandmates, Segundo performs classics such as "Chan Chan," "La Ternera," "Fidelidad," "Lagrimas Negras" and "Ahora Me Da Pena."
link.title: synopsis
Beats of the Heart: Salsa: Latin Pop Music in the Cities
John McLaughlin, Larry Coryell and Paco De Lucia: Meeting of the Spirits
Carlos Santana & Wayne Shorter: Live at the Montreux Jazz Festival
Beats of the Heart: Spirit of Samba: Black Music of Brazil
Beats of the Heart: Tex-Mex: Music of the Borderlands
Classic Albums: U2: The Joshua Tree
J.K. Rowling and the Birth of Harry Potter
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement
Arthur Ashe: Citizen of the World
Brother Outsider: The Life of Bayard Rustin
Empires: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
The Kid Stays in the Picture

link.synopsis: After his fiance is terrorized and run off the road by a biker gang, Green Beret sergeant Mitch (Tony Young) is intent on avenging her death. Along with three soldier pals -- Jim (Marvin Gaye), Al (Peter Brown) and Hank (Michael Stearns) -- Mitch goes undercover as a badass motorcyclist. After locating the gang and their hell-on-wheels leader, T.J. (William Smith), Mitch and his buddies lure them into a fierce battle at their mountain hideout.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Village idiot Aloysius (Paul Campbell), who talks to trees, shrubs and cows, falls under the spell of Inga (Julie T. Wallace), a busty German nymphomaniac who's visiting his small Jamaican town. When Inga runs out of money, she persuades him to break into a wealthy man's (Reggie Carter) house. Music video director Lol Creme helms this quirky, fantastical comedy based on a novel by Anthony C. Winkler.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Tired Black Man
How Much Do You Love Me?
Five on the Black Hand Side
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
Just Another Girl on the I.R.T.
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy

link.synopsis: An all-star cast anchors this comedy about jobless Sol Goode (Balthazar Getty), who has gal pal issues. But when he meets the woman of his dreams, will his good looks and quick wit shine through? First, he has to settle matters with his casual fling, Tammie (Tori Spelling). Jamie Kennedy plays Sol's high-maintenance roommate, Justin (Jamie Kennedy). Watch for cameos by Cheri Oteri, Johnathon Schaech and Jared Leto.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this lightweight French comedy from screenwriter-turned-director Daniele Thompson, three daughters, Sonia (Emmanuelle Béart), Louba (Sabine Azéma) and Milla (Charlotte Gainsbourg), scheme to reunite their parents, who divorced 25 years ago and haven't spoken to each other since. It's a Christmas dinner that will give every person from a dysfunctional family a nod of acknowledgement and many laughs.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The City of Your Final Destination

link.synopsis: At various social gatherings, Charles (Hugh Grant), a commitment-phobic Brit, tries to reconnect with Carrie (Andie MacDowell), a beautiful, alluring American who's about to make a seemingly terrible mistake by marrying a wealthy, boring man (Corin Redgrave). Kristin Scott Thomas, John Hannah, James Fleet and Simon Callow co-star in this lighthearted comedy about love, friendship and fate. But, as the title suggests, there's a tragedy in the mix.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain

link.synopsis: After her fiancée, Charlie (Timothy Hutton), calls off the engagement because he's met a beautiful Frenchwoman, American Kate (Meg Ryan) flies to Paris to win him back. But on the plane, she encounters cunning French thief Luc (Kevin Kline), who plants stolen jewels on her. While trying to recover the goods, Luc pretends to help Kate find Charlie -- but the City of Lights soon works its amorous magic on the couple in this warm romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: While researching a role for an independent film, an aging actor (Morgan Freeman) strikes up an unlikely -- and life-changing -- friendship with a feisty young Latina grocery clerk (Paz Vega) in this inspiring comedy from writer-director Brad Silberling. Stranded at a tiny market on the edge of Los Angeles, the famous actor accepts a ride from the sassy store employee, and the odd couple hits the road on a trip filled with surprising revelations.
link.title: synopsis
Journey to the End of the Night
A Love Song for Bobby Long
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Will Ferrell stars as a Spanish-speaking cowboy in this comedy about a Mexican clan trying to rescue their ranch from greedy creditors. When his brother can't save the day, the simple but noble ranch hand takes on a powerful drug lord.
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life

link.synopsis: This adult-oriented comedy follows the curious exploits of John, a slacker whose constant companion, Ted -- a childhood teddy bear who's actually come to life -- threatens to derail his belated attempts to enter adulthood and romance his dream girl.
link.title: synopsis
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story
Family Guy: Something, Something, Something, Dark Side
Family Guy: Partial Terms of Endearment
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
The Man Who Could Work Miracles

link.synopsis: Against his old man's (Michael McKean) wishes, a hopelessly dorky guy named Power (Ari Gold) up and jets out of his dingy hometown of Lode, N.M., to follow through on his ambition to become the greatest air drummer the world has ever witnessed. Power soon sets his sights on meeting Rush drummer Neil Peart in this comedy Gold also wrote and directed. Jane Lynch, Jimmy Jean-Louis and Adrian Grenier co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu
The Year of Getting to Know Us
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: Ever attend a hilarious nightclub comedy set by a red-hot comedian? Unless you live in a major city, chances are you haven't witnessed the real thing. Now you can enjoy the finest comedians at the top of their form in the comfort of your own home. Included are such sidesplitting masters as Adam Sandler, Cheech Marin, Chris Rock, Drew Carey, Ellen DeGeneres, Janeane Garofalo and many more.
link.title: synopsis
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
The Dick Cavett Show: Comic Legends
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
The Best of the Improv: Vol. 6
I Think I Love My Wife
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth

title.regular: The Very Best of America's Funniest Comedians
title.short: Very Best of America's Funniest Comedians

link.synopsis: When Stefania breaks up with her boyfriend, Andrea, little does she realize what the summer has in store for her. She and her 14-year-old niece, Meggy, wind up on vacation at a beautiful Greek resort, where her niece sets out to lose her virginity; in an ironic twist, the cute guy Meggy has her eye on turns out to be none other than Stefania's ex, Andrea! This light-hearted comedy is a valuable lesson in what it means to be a woman at any age.
link.title: synopsis
The Night of the Shooting Stars

link.synopsis: Comedy acting legend John Candy turns in a signature performance in this effort from director John Hughes as a notoriously irresponsible uncle left to care for his brother's kids during a family crisis. Packed with a host of noteworthy supporting performances, the heartwarming family comedy also features Macaulay Culkin in an early career role shortly before his breakout turn in the Home Alone franchise.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
The Brady Bunch in the White House

link.synopsis: Spencer Tracy renders one of his most endearing roles as Stanley Banks, the befuddled title character in this charming comedy directed by Vincente Minnelli. Stanley gets caught up in the barely controlled mayhem surrounding his only daughter's (a ravishing Elizabeth Taylor) wedding. Class struggle, premarital jitters and a whole lot of grumpy comedy mark this as a classic film you shouldn't miss.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Time I Saw Paris
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

link.synopsis: This charming comedy directed by Sam Wood features graceful Ginger Rogers in the role of street-smart delinquent Arlette Lafron, who masters the art of picking pockets at an unusual school for criminals run by enterprising Prof. Aristide (Basil Rathbone). Assigned to pinch a valuable watch from moneyed diplomat Pierre de Roche (Jean Pierre Aumont), Arlette botches the job -- and ends up falling for her prospective mark in the bargain.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride
The Last Time I Saw Paris
The Strange Affair of Uncle Harry

link.synopsis: After her son is killed in a hit-and-run accident, writer Beverly Lowry (Diane Keaton) sinks into a morose obsession with death. Eager to learn more about the mind of a killer, Beverly befriends incarcerated Texas murderer Karla Faye Tucker (Jennifer Jason Leigh). Their unlikely friendship takes the pair on an unexpected journey of healing. Maury Chaykin co-stars as Beverly's frustrated husband in this gripping true-crime melodrama.
link.title: synopsis
The Power of Forgiveness: The Story of Karla Faye Tucker

link.synopsis: This seemingly simple French comedy about a seaside romance boasts strong performances and unexpected depth. Continuing his "Comedies et Proverbes" series, director Eric Rohmer explores how two cousins, the inexperienced Pauline and the advice-ready Marion, juggle their summertime beaus. While Pauline learns some important lessons in love, Marion is the one who doesn't end up the wiser.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Three college pals disillusioned with their lackluster social lives decide they need a change of venue. So they pack up and head to New Orleans, where they find plenty of alcohol-fueled party action as they try to change their luck with the ladies. Phil Dornfeld directs this raunchy comedy from Maxim magazine's production company, starring Carmen Electra, Danneel Harris, Nicholas D'Agosto, Arielle Kebbel, Regina Hall and Josh Gad.
link.title: synopsis
World of the Dead: The Zombie Diaries 2
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Strict patriarch Ira Stuckman (Michael Lerner) experiences religious ecstasy -- literally -- after being slipped a hallucinogenic drug during the family's Passover Seder meal. With a little psychedelic inspiration, the once-gruff and critical Ira embraces the spirit of the holiday, vowing to guide his contentious clan toward forgiveness and harmony. Jack Klugman co-stars in director Salvador Litvak's chemically laced domestic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
They Came for Good: A History of the Jews in the United States: Taking Root 1820-1880
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
They Came for Good: A History of the Jews in the United States: Present at the Creation 1654-1820
A Life Apart: Hasidism in America
The Jewish People: A Story of Survival

link.synopsis: After futon salesman Bob Funk's (Michael Leydon Campbell) alcoholism and acerbic attitude cause his own mother (Grace Zabriskie) to fire him, he tries to get his life together and reclaim his job. But his attraction to the woman (Rachael Leigh Cook) who's replaced him complicates everything. Meanwhile, Funk's seeing the therapist his mother requires and dealing with the repercussions of his failed marriage. Amy Ryan co-stars in this witty comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Ten years after his twin brother Rick (Aden Young) unwittingly steals away high school girl-of-his-dreams Melissa (Saffron Burrows), Stephen (Simon Bossell) gets a second chance at winning her heart when he runs into her at a tacky romantic resort. But Rick, Stephen's quarreling parents and Melissa's new beau Norman (Peter O'Brien) all complicate his mission. Pippa Grandison co-stars in this romantic comedy from director Craig Rosenberg.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Movie critic Richard Roeper hosts this hilarious look at the best boundary-pushing gross-out comedies in film history, including Superbad, The Meaning of Life, Animal House, American Pie, Blazing Saddles, Porky's and many more. Along with classic (and outrageous) film clips, this special includes interviews with John Waters, Jason Biggs, Stephen Furst, Peter Riegert, Lin Shaye and a slew of other actors, writers, directors and film critics.
link.title: synopsis
Starz Inside: Sex and the Cinema
Going to Pieces: The Rise and Fall of the Slasher Film
Starz Inside: The Face Is Familiar
Nightmares in Red, White and Blue
Legendary Sin Cities: Paris, Berlin and Shanghai
This Film Is Not Yet Rated
Starz Inside: Anime: Drawing A Revolution
William S. Burroughs: A Man Within
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
Private Practices: The Story of a Sex Surrogate
Texas Chainsaw Massacre: A Family Portrait
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project

link.synopsis: Tough-talking Detroit cop Axel Foley (Eddie Murphy) heads to the rarified world of Beverly Hills in his beat-up Chevy Nova to investigate a friend's murder. But soon, he realizes he's stumbled onto something much more complicated. Bungling rookie detective Billy Rosewood (Judge Reinhold) joins the fish-out-of-water Axel and shows him the West Los Angeles ropes in director Martin Brest's Academy Award-nominated action comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy

link.synopsis: The Farrelly brothers nail the laughs in this hugely popular comedy about a hugely popular girl. Mary (Cameron Diaz) is the ideal girlfriend of every guy she meets, especially frustrated high school suitor Ted (Ben Stiller). But he's got plenty of competition from Matt Dillon and other unexpected rivals. This special edition includes the original theatrical version and a new extended version with extra footage.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: German-born, Florida-raised laugh master Daniel Tosh takes his act to San Francisco for his first-ever stand-up special for Comedy Central -- also home to his hit show "Tosh.0," which spotlights hilarious Internet video clips. Tosh's "happy thoughts" may not jive with your own, but what does it matter when they make you laugh until it hurts in this torturously funny show from the comic who's compared life on tour to the film Groundhog Day?
link.title: synopsis
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Kevin Hart: I'm a Grown Little Man
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Sold Out: A Threevening with Kevin Smith
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show

link.synopsis: Inspired by Cold War paranoia, author Graham Greene penned this cynical comedy directed by Carol Reed about vacuum cleaner salesman Jim Wormold (Alec Guinness), whose territory happens to be pre-revolutionary Cuba. Approached by an undercover intelligence agent (Noel Coward), Jim unwittingly agrees to provide espionage services to the British government. This hilarious political farce earned a Golden Globe Best Comedy nomination in 1960.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Man in the White Suit
Agatha Christie Marple: The Pale Horse

link.synopsis: When small-town girl Hazel Flagg (Carole Lombard) mistakenly believes that she's dying of radium poisoning, she's brought to the big city and turned into a media darling by exploitative journalist Wally Cook (Fredric March). The two fall in love, and once the truth about Hazel's condition is revealed, it's too late to stop the presses or their feelings in this screwball comedy classic from Hollywood's Golden Age.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Peter Hall directs this fine Royal Shakespeare Company adaptation of the Bard's most pixilated romantic comedy about a group of amorous adults -- under a fairy's spell -- that couple and uncouple at the slightest provocation. ("What fools these mortals be.") Stars Diana Rigg, Judi Dench, Ian Holm, Helen Mirren, Ian Richardson and David Warner. One of Shakespeare's most magical plays (and unusual in that it lacks a written source for the plot).
link.title: synopsis
The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, and Her Lover
Sherlock Holmes: The Hound of the Baskervilles

link.synopsis: Determined to receive treatment, Bob Wiley (Bill Murray), a neurotic New Yorker struggling with a host of paralyzing phobias, follows his psychiatrist on vacation in this quirky family comedy. Pompous shrink Dr. Leo Marvin (Richard Dreyfuss) tries to get rid of the unwanted patient, but Bob ingratiates himself with Marvin's family. Soon Marvin's wife and children, charmed by Bob's childlike enthusiasm, start to think Bob is more fun than Marvin.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Little
Down and Out in Beverly Hills
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas

link.synopsis: This quirky cult comedy penned by Terrence Malick features Alan Arkin as Cooper, a trucker working for a shady outfit who picks up a stolen rig full of who-knows-what and heads off for who-knows-where. Lacking a traditional plot, Cooper's encounters with a bizarre cadre of outcasts are presented as a series of vignettes. Among those he meets are characters played by Bruce Bennett, Hector Elizondo, Charles Durning, Paul Benedict and Loretta Swit.
link.title: synopsis
Flatbed Annie and Sweetie Pie: Lady Truckers
Take This Job and Shove It

link.synopsis: When the Muppets graduate from Danhurst College, they take their song-filled senior revue to New York City, only to learn that it isn't easy to find a producer who's willing to back a show starring a frog and a pig. Of course, Kermit the Frog and Miss Piggy won't take no for an answer, launching a search for someone to take them to Broadway. Jim Henson, Dave Goelz and director Frank Oz provide most of the voices for this Oscar-nominated comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
Fraggle Rock: Where It All Began
Wallace & Gromit in Three Amazing Adventures
The Looney, Looney, Looney Bugs Bunny Movie
Fraggle Rock: Down in Fraggle Rock
The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
Roxy Hunter and the Myth of the Mermaid
Sesame Street: 20 Years ... and Still Counting

link.synopsis: Bill Foster (Michael Douglas) is having a very bad day: He's been fired from his job, gets stuck in a traffic jam and is forced to walk through the sizzling L.A. streets. As the obstacles mount and his temper frays, Foster begins lashing out at society's injustices. Joel Schumacher's dark comedy also stars Robert Duvall as an overzealous cop who gets wind of Foster's near-psychotic rampage and sets out to bring him down.
link.title: synopsis
Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

link.synopsis: In this unconventional romantic comedy that gives new meaning to the term "cold feet," bride-to-be Rachel (Piper Perabo) is love-struck -- not with her groom, but rather with another woman who's a guest at their wedding. As she's marching down the aisle with her longtime sweetheart, Heck (Matthew Goode), Rachel is immediately bewitched by a beautiful guest (Lena Headey). But following her heart's true desire is hardly an easy proposition.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Nick Twisp (Michael Cera), a cynical, sex-deprived teenager living a less-than-satisfactory existence, is pushed by the manifestation of his debonair, rebellious id (also Cera) to bed his dream girl, Sheeni Saunders (Portia Doubleday). Miguel Arteta directs this irreverent, dark comedy based on the popular novel series by C.D. Payne. Steve Buscemi, Ray Liotta, Justin Long, Fred Willard, Jean Smart, M. Emmet Walsh and Zach Galifianakis co-star.
link.title: synopsis
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell

link.synopsis: This dry British comedy stars Robert Pattinson as Art, a twentysomething musician who, after being unceremoniously dumped by his girlfriend, moves back in with his parents in order to face the challenges of his quarter-life crisis. Soon, Art enlists the services of a self-help guru to follow him wherever he goes, inspiring a series of hilarious situations -- along with some heartfelt discoveries about life and relationships.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: When Homer (Jules Dassin) -- a would-be philosopher from the States -- takes a trip to Greece, he meets free-spirited prostitute Ilya (Melina Mercouri) and arrogantly decides to become her Svengali in this internationally celebrated classic. But Homer may wind up learning a few lessons from his protégé. Dassin also wrote and directed the romantic comedy, which garnered several Oscar nominations, snagging a win for Best Song.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Costume Design Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Costume Design Black and White nominee

link.title: Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: This lighthearted comedy finds successful professional David (Marcus Harwell) turning 40 and realizing time is running out to find true love. Wondering if he's already met Mr. Right, David throws a pool party to reevaluate his chemistry with several ex-boyfriends. While David searches for the perfect husband at the unusual and lively event, he also must offer guidance to his troubled nephew and wrangle an interfering, would-be mother-in-law.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2

link.synopsis: This captivating screwball comedy stars Cary Grant and Irene Dunne as Jerry and Lucy Warriner, a married couple who mistakenly suspect each other of infidelity and file for divorce -- but then go to ridiculous lengths to make each other jealous. Ralph Bellamy is hilarious as Dunne's new suitor, Grant and Dunne have rarely been better, and a scene-stealing pooch provides some hearty laughs. Leo McCarey won an Oscar for his sprightly direction.
link.title: synopsis
Irene Dunne Romance Classics: Love Affair / Penny Serenade
You Can't Take It with You
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Athletically challenged misfits Clark (Jon Heder), Gus (Rob Schneider) and Richie (David Spade) learn it's never too late for glory in this goofy sports comedy that proves every (under)dog has its day -- even though it might take, say, 20 years. Humiliated as children on the baseball field, the now-adult trio forms a three-man team to take on the top Little League squads, becoming unlikely champions for uncoordinated kids everywhere.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Major League 3: Back to the Minors
Out of Left Field: The Making of the Chinese Baseball Team

link.synopsis: You'll be rolling on the floor with laughter when you view this collection, part of a series that showcases the early stage work of some of America's funniest and best-loved comedians. This compendium features none other than Bob Hope and Bob Newhart. Their earliest clips display their timing and genius -- proving they were pros from the very start -- and provide a rare glimpse into the career trajectory of two brilliant performers.
link.title: synopsis
The Premature Burial / The Man with the X-Ray Eyes
The Golden Age of TV Drama
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
I Love Lucy: Lucy's Really Lost Moments
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Comedy Express Presents: Al Ducharme: Spineless and Lovin' It
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army

link.synopsis: When she agrees to appear in a play by up-and-coming playwright Stanley Krown (William Holden), aging Broadway star Beatrice Page (Ginger Rogers) cannot believe that she's too old to be cast in the starring role -- that of a teenage girl. Now Beatrice's delusion sparks a comic fracas between her producer ex-husband, the stubborn writer and an ambitious young starlet (Pat Crowley) who wants the role for herself. Irving Rapper directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Ashton Kutcher stars in this remake of the 1967 classic Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? But the tables are turned this time around, as he plays the fiancé of an African-American woman (Zoe Saldana) who's met with skepticism and suspicion from her father (Bernie Mac). Tension flares -- along with comedy -- when she takes him home for the all-important introduction, and as the wedding approaches, Dad must come to terms with his future son-in-law.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"

link.synopsis: Lasse Hallstrom's witty romantic comedy stars Heath Ledger as Jacamo Casanova, the infamous and dashing player of 18th-century Venice who holds the key to every woman's heart -- every woman, that is, but one.
link.title: synopsis
Tribute to Heath Ledger: The Unauthorized Story
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: The Farrelly brothers loosely adapt the 1972 hit of the same name into this romantic comedy starring Ben Stiller as Eddie Cantrow, a newlywed who marries a dreamy woman (Malin Akerman) only to learn on his honeymoon that she's a total nightmare. As the discovery sets in, Eddie meets the real girl of his dreams (Michelle Monaghan) … but what to do now that he's already married? Jerry Stiller, Carlos Mencia and Rob Corddry co-star.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Recruited by the U.S. government to be a special agent, nerdy adolescent Cody Banks must get close to a cute classmate to learn about an evil plan hatched by her father. But despite the agent persona, Cody struggles with teen angst.
link.title: synopsis
Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
Kim Possible Movie: So the Drama
R.L. Stine's The Haunting Hour: Don't Think About It
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
Spy Kids: All the Time in the World
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore

link.synopsis: Even though they're not the young hep cats they once were, Chris Pepper (Peter Lawford) and Charlie Salt (Sammy Davis Jr.) are convinced they still have what it takes to swing with the best of them. With their London bar in danger of closing, the two must find a way to attract more customers, but Salt and Pepper's efforts draw them into the dangerous world of global politics and espionage in director Richard Donner's slapstick comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis

link.synopsis: Saucy cabaret singer Lady Lou (Mae West) keeps plenty of men entertained but finds protection from a criminal ex-lover in the arms of a young Salvation Army captain (Cary Grant). Director Lowell Sherman's witty comedy was nominated for a Best Picture Oscar. This classic Mae West flick gave Cary Grant his breakthrough role and produced the American Film Institute's 26th top movie line of all time: "Why don't you come up sometime and see me?"
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
The Private Life of Henry VIII
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: Washed-up sitcom star Valerie Cherish (Lisa Kudrow) lowers her standards and agrees to star in a reality television show. The cameras roll as Valerie, in a brazen attempt to revive her career, stops at nothing to steal the spotlight from her  single roommates. Robert Michael Morris, Damian Young, Laura Silverman, Malin Akerman, Robert Bagnell and Lance Barber co-star in this HBO comedy series from Michael Patrick King ("Sex and the City").
link.title: synopsis
The Comeback: The Complete Series: Disc 1
The Comeback: The Complete Series: Disc 2
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
Andy Richter Controls the Universe: The Complete Series
Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show
Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
The Life & Death of Peter Sellers
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Dr. Katz: Professional Therapist: The Complete Series
Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series
Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 2
Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Invited to perform at a casino in remote Alice Springs, Australia, drag queens Mitzi (Hugo Weaving) and Felicia (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp) hit the road in a broken-down lavender bus named Priscilla in this campy comedy classic. Along the way, the friends change into their most outrageous costumes and lip-synch disco tunes -- including plenty of ABBA -- for the outback's befuddled locals.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou

title.regular: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert

link.synopsis: In this HBO special, Emmy-winning comedian and writer Louis C.K. performs his controversial brand of no-holds-barred stand-up comedy in front of an exuberant audience at the Henry Fonda Theater in Los Angeles. Touching on everything from the pros and cons of weight gain and taking bumper stickers personally to deceiving your spouse and losing your privacy, the caustic comedian provides tons of sidesplitting -- and often X-rated -- moments.
link.title: synopsis
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
Bill Burr: Why Do I Do This
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Kevin Hart: I'm a Grown Little Man
Comedy Express Presents: Al Ducharme: Spineless and Lovin' It
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"

link.synopsis: Jean Harris aka Countess Louise (Mitzi Gaynor) is a card shark traveling on an ocean voyage with her father, Col. Patrick Henry Harris (David Niven). She does well for herself -- that is, until she falls for the man she just fleeced, the very rich Hotsy Hamilton (George Gobel). When Hamilton finds out the truth about Jean/Louise, will love prevail? Norman Taurog directs this screwball comedy centered on a romantic game of one-upmanship.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: Barely competent pet private eye Ace Ventura (Jim Carrey) is put on the case when kidnappers abduct Snowflake, the Miami Dolphins' mascot. As Ventura tries to unravel the mammal-napping and save the day, the perpetrators have something else in mind. Some of the team's star players, including quarterback Dan Marino (playing himself) also go missing amid the Hawaiian shirts and smart-aleck humor in director Tom Shadyac's slapstick comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Ace Ventura: The Case of the Serial Shaver: Multipath Adventure
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
If It's Tuesday, It Still Must be Belgium
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

link.synopsis: Though she works half a world away in Mumbai, India, a credit card company operator passes herself off as American to callers. When she falls in love with a New York man over the phone, she agrees to meet him in person. They arrange for a rendezvous in San Francisco, where she keeps the truth about her identity a provocative secret. Shriya and Jesse Metcalfe ("Desperate Housewives") star in this charming romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance

title.regular: The Other End of the Line
title.short: The Other End of the Line

link.synopsis: At a crossroads in his life, New Yorker Roger Greenberg (Ben Stiller) takes time to figure things out and travels to Los Angeles, where he house-sits for his brother and forges an unlikely bond with his sibling's assistant, Florence Marr (Greta Gerwig). Acclaimed director Noah Baumbach's finely observed relationship comedy garnered Independent Spirit Award nominations for Best Feature and for lead actors Stiller and Gerwig.
link.title: synopsis
It's Kind of a Funny Story
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: When well-endowed Jake fails to make it as an underwear model, he finds work as a platonic escort for wealthy older women. But Jake's new gig soon becomes inconvenient in this comedy co-starring Morgan Fairchild as one of the "cougars."
link.title: synopsis
The Perfect Age of Rock 'n' Roll
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood

link.synopsis: This goofy Internet comedy series follows the fictional romantic misadventures of director David Wain as he visits a dodgy massage parlor, takes lessons from a pickup artist and otherwise tries to ramp up his love life in the Big Apple.
link.title: synopsis
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair

link.synopsis: This comedy series centers on the life and struggles of Warwick Davis, an accomplished dwarf actor who plays a fictional version of himself. Warwick runs a talent agency called Dwarves for Hire but usually saves the best roles for himself.
link.title: synopsis
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
Monty Python and the Holy Grail

link.synopsis: Conflicted ventriloquist Jerry Morgan (Danny Kaye) can't get the voices out of his head: First his dolls ruin a marriage prospect, and then they return from the repair shop with noggins full of classified data and a pack of spies in pursuit. In this delirious comedy, Morgan assumes one identity after another as he gives the agents the slip, while Dr. Ilse Nordstrom (Mai Zetterling) plays a psychiatric role -- and then some -- in the proceedings.
link.title: synopsis
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Man in the White Suit
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?

link.synopsis: With his parents on vacation, high schooler Joel (Tom Cruise) -- abetted by a prostitute named Lana (Rebecca De Mornay) -- turns opportunity into disaster as he transforms the family home into a brothel, sees a Porsche end up in Lake Michigan and watches his Princeton dreams fade. A pair of briefs, a Bob Seeger tune and some heartfelt lip-syncing catapulted Cruise to stardom in this now-classic Golden Globe-nominated teen comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Born on the Fourth of July

link.synopsis: Set off the coast of South America during the Napoleonic Wars, this thrilling maritime drama pits "Lucky" Jack Aubrey (Russell Crowe), captain of the &NFi;HMS Surprise&NFi_;, and his close-knit crew against a French privateer equipped with better weapons. This action-adventure, which won Oscars for Best Cinematography and Best Sound Editing, is based on the novels of Patrick O'Brian and co-stars Paul Bettany, Billy Boyd and James D'Arcy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

link.title: To the Ends of the Earth
The Old Man and the Sea
The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford

title.regular: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World

link.synopsis: Craig Ferguson and Kevin Pollak head the cast in this twisted indie comedy that follows a collection of self-serving misfits who call the low-rent, fleabag Niagara Motel home. Among the colorful characters whose lives intersect are a pretty but obtuse waitress (Caroline Dhavernas), a professional couple (Wendy Crewson and Peter Keleghan) experiencing a run of bad luck and a slimy purveyor of pornography (Pollak).
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
The Year of Getting to Know Us

link.synopsis: In this indie comedy from helmer Bob Byington, dry wit and deadpan humor abound as aptly named lyricist Harmony (Justin Rice) insists on wallowing in misery eons after being unceremoniously dumped by his girlfriend, the lovely Jessica (Kristen Tucker). While the members of Harmony's family are long over his antics, that doesn't stop him from milking his heartbreak and telling his tale of woe to anyone who will listen.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Legendary funnyman Buster Keaton stars in this wild and woolly comedy as Willie McKay, a Yankee traveling in the antebellum South who unwittingly finds himself on the business end of a blood feud being waged by his would-be sweetheart's clan.
link.title: synopsis
Arbuckle & Keaton: The Original Comique Paramount Shorts 1917-1920: Vol. 1
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection

link.synopsis: It's the swinging 1960s in New York City, and all the ladies are angling for the attention of handsome journalist Catcher Block (Ewan McGregor). All of them save Barbara Novak (Renée Zellweger), a feminist advice columnist who stands for everything the womanizing Block doesn't. David Hyde Pierce, Tony Randall and Sarah Paulson co-star in this colorful tribute to the classic Doris Day-Rock Hudson romantic comedies.
link.title: synopsis
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: Dutiful daughter Wil (Michelle Krusiec) sidesteps her mother's (Joan Chen) attempts to marry her off in Alice Wu's romantic comedy. At 28, Wil's the old maid of her traditional Chinese family, so there's no way she can tell them about her budding lesbian romance with Vivian (Lynn Chen). But her widowed mom has her own problems, as she learns she's pregnant at 48. Kicked out by her disapproving father, she seeks refuge at Wil's place.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love
Love and Death on Long Island
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Two 12-year-olds (Emma Roberts and pop singer JoJo) get more than they bargained for when they discover sassy mermaid Aquamarine (Sara Paxton) lolling at the bottom of their beach club's pool, having come ashore to search for true love. Before you can say "fish out of water," the finned beauty develops a crush on a boy who works at the club and recruits the girls to help her capture his heart in this family comedy directed by Elizabeth Allen.
link.title: synopsis
Roxy Hunter and the Myth of the Mermaid
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
